post_text: Want a quick look at what the Wednesday schedules look like? All students are invited (cohorts A-D) to participate in zooms on Wednesdays together. 6-12 students will be together each day but our PK-5 will have a Social-Emotional Component and other opportunities for academic supports with our staff as well. If your child can't make it on Wednesdays due to daycare concerns, please let your child's teacher know and we will work something out with your child.

post_text: The RSU #4 team of teachers and administrators have been working hard to get ready for Cohort D students! Please remember that device and instructional material pick up at Central Office is all next week (see icon below for days and times). Once you come to get your materials, you will learn more about how to log into your programs and the schedule to be able to start school with your teachers on September 21st. PK-5 students will have an assigned remote RISE teacher(s); whereas, 6-12 students will be following their normal class schedule with their assigned grade level teachers. More information to come on September 21st. We look forward to seeing you next week!

post_text:
Good Morning Everyone,

It looks like a good percentage of RSU #4 is either without power or without internet and from what I am hearing a good portion of our teachers are facing the same challenge today. So, that being said let's look at today as a "make-up" day! Work on the work you already have, check in through email/seesaw/google classroom if possible, and just breathe.

Hopefully this weather will go away and we can enjoy the weekend. Take care of yourselves and each other!

-Andy

post_text: Red/White Calendar
text: Red/White Calendar

post_text:
RSU #4 Updates Regarding Remote Learning:

I am reaching out today to let you know that beginning on Monday, we will start Phase II of our Educational Plan. This means your students will be engaged in new learning activities with their teacher. I ask you to be patient with us and most importantly with yourselves as we attempt this. It is new to all of us and the best analogy I can think of is we are building an airplane while we are trying to fly it. Our staff has done an amazing job of trying to put this together to meet everyone's needs and I want to commend them publicly for all of their hard work.

Below is a video from Mrs. Martin and information that is a general overview of what we are doing. If you need support please don't hesitate to reach out to your child's teacher(s) or principal for help.

Lastly I want to give a big shout out to all of our Food Service staff, our bus drivers, and the volunteers that are working together to provide meals. The work they are doing is amazing and I want them to know how much I appreciate it.

-Andy
text:
RSU #4 Updates Regarding Remote Learning:

I am reaching out today to let you know that beginning on Monday, we will start Phase II of our Educational Plan. This means your students will be engaged in new learning activities with their teacher. I ask you to be patient with us and most importantly with yourselves as we attempt this. It is new to all of us and the best analogy I can think of is we are building an airplane while we are trying to fly it. Our staff has done an amazing job of trying to put this together to meet everyone's needs and I want to commend them publicly for all of their hard work.

Below is a video from Mrs. Martin and information that is a general overview of what we are doing. If you need support please don't hesitate to reach out to your child's teacher(s) or principal for help.

Lastly I want to give a big shout out to all of our Food Service staff, our bus drivers, and the volunteers that are working together to provide meals. The work they are doing is amazing and I want them to know how much I appreciate it.

-Andy

post_text: Please take note for Friday!

post_text:
Super Update:

Good Morning Everyone,
I wanted to reach out this morning and thank you all for the emails I have received regarding the change in food service. I appreciate the feedback and also the understanding that we are just trying to do what is right for our communities.

Given that, beginning this Friday, in addition to the bus runs, we will be adding the option to pick up a lunch at Central Office (971 Gardiner Road in Wales) from 10am-12pm on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. I am hopeful this will help to alleviate some of the concern I received with the bus runs.

As always I appreciate your patience and understanding as we navigate some difficult times.

Take care of each other,
Andy

I am hopeful this will help to alleviate some of the concern I received with the bus runs.

As always I appreciate your patience and understanding as we navigate some difficult times.

Take care of each other,
Andy

post_text: Food Distribution Update:
text: Food Distribution Update:

post_text:
Food Updates!
Good Morning Everyone,
I wanted to update all of you that beginning tomorrow, we will be changing our lunch distribution. On Wednesday, our buses will run their elementary routes beginning at 10am. They will stop at their regular stops and wait to see if someone comes out. Please keep an eye out. Our amazing bus drivers will be doing their run twice so if you miss them the first time please keep an eye out for their second stop. This will be happening on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. I wish I could give you approximate times but at this point where this is the first time we are doing this I just cannot. Feel free to check out our website for stops along the route so if your child doesn't normally take the bus, you can meet them at any of the bus stops.

Thank you all for your patience and understanding as we navigate this ever changing situation. We are a strong community and I know that together we will get through this.

-Andy
text:
Food Updates!
Good Morning Everyone,
I wanted to update all of you that beginning tomorrow, we will be changing our lunch distribution. On Wednesday, our buses will run their elementary routes beginning at 10am. They will stop at their regular stops and wait to see if someone comes out. Please keep an eye out. Our amazing bus drivers will be doing their run twice so if you miss them the first time please keep an eye out for their second stop. This will be happening on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. I wish I could give you approximate times but at this point where this is the first time we are doing this I just cannot. Feel free to check out our website for stops along the route so if your child doesn't normally take the bus, you can meet them at any of the bus stops.

Thank you all for your patience and understanding as we navigate this ever changing situation. We are a strong community and I know that together we will get through this.

-Andy

post_text:
RSU #4 Update:
Good Afternoon, As you may know, on Sunday March 15th Governor Mills provided a recommendation that Maine schools cease classroom based instruction for the duration of the State of Civil Emergency. The state of civil emergency is in effect for 30 days and may be reissued as many times as the situation warrants. I am calling today to let you know that RSU #4 will be following Governor Mills' recommendation and will remain closed until Monday April 27th.

We know that the libraries are closed and some of you would love books to read to your kids. Please remember that there are two “sharing libraries” in RSU #4. One has been installed at Oak Hill Cash Market and one at Sabattus Primary School.

The rules are simple: choose some books, read and enjoy, return for others to enjoy.

post_text:
Food Update:
RSU #4 will be operating remote feeding sites at the various locations during the school closure on certain days. This week, students/families can pick up on Friday and then next week on Mondays (get two days worth of food) and Wednesdays only (getting three days worth of food). These sites will be open from 11am-2pm. Students 20 and under can get a free breakfast and lunch. Parents can pick up for students that are at home if needed.

Wales:
Town office - 175 Centre Rd
Presbyterian Church - 688 Pond Rd/ Rt. 132
Sabattus
Sabattus Primary School - 36 No Name Pond Rd
Fire Station - 488 Crowley Rd
Leon Hinkley Farm - 202 Williams Rd
Baseball Field - Pleasant Hill Rd

Litchfield
Purgatory Station- 1372 Hallowell Rd
Litchfield County Store- 1908 Hallowell Rd
Central Station-2407 Hallowell Rd
Libby Tozier School- 466 Academy Rd

post_text: Thank you to all the amazing staff that came in today to help prepare for our distance learning. Please know that RSU #4 plans to send more details about learning, food and other important information in the next few days, as we plan to not start the academic portion until next Monday. We are all working together through this fluid situation and appreciate your patience. We will continue to update you on this social media site, our School Messenger, as well as our official website. Take care of yourselves and your loved ones through this time!

Take care of yourselves and your loved ones through this time!

post_text:
Libby-Tozier Families:
Due to losing the power at Libby Tozier this morning and Central Maine Power not being able to give us a timeline for restoring power, we are going to be dismissing all students at Libby Tozier School early today. At this time students are being bused to Carrie Ricker School so they can have access to bathrooms. Students will be leaving Carrie Ricker School on their buses at 10am. If parents would like to pick their children up they can be dismissed from Carrie Ricker School beginning at 9:30am. Thank you in advance for your understanding and we hope the power will be back on for tomorrow.

Thanks,
Andy Carlton
text:
Libby-Tozier Families:

If parents would like to pick their children up they can be dismissed from Carrie Ricker School beginning at 9:30am. Thank you in advance for your understanding and we hope the power will be back on for tomorrow.

Thanks,
Andy Carlton

October 14, 2019 at 3:06 PM ·

Asking for help to make the best truck or treat ever. The 8th grade class is doing a haunted walk to raise money for end of year celebration. We are looking for parents and children's to help with decorations. We are having a meet at middle school on Wednesday October 16th 6pm to plan the walk and gather decorations. "This is our kids kick off to raising money to take that 8th grade class trip and a opportunity for children to volunteer " Give back" ALL DECORATIONS THAT ARE BORROWED WILL BE LABELED AND RETURNED. We appreciate any one who can take the time to help or loan us some decor. If you can't make it Wednesday and have decorations we may be able to use please contact. Thanks

post_text:
Good Afternoon,

This is Andy Carlton calling you to let you know that this afternoon around 1:15pm a car driving by Libby Tozier School caught fire in front of the school. Litchfield Fire Department is on scene and has extinguished the fire and everyone is safe. Students have been kept in the building and are going about their day as planned other than not going outside. The scene is currently impacting access to the building but should be cleaned up soon. If you need to get your students early please just call ahead.

Thanks,
Andy
text:
Good Afternoon,

This is Andy Carlton calling you to let you know that this afternoon around 1:15pm a car driving by Libby Tozier School caught fire in front of the school. Litchfield Fire Department is on scene and has extinguished the fire and everyone is safe. Students have been kept in the building and are going about their day as planned other than not going outside. The scene is currently impacting access to the building but should be cleaned up soon. If you need to get your students early please just call ahead.

Thanks,
Andy

post_text:
Update on April's Bus:
A truck just crossed the center line and hit April's side mirror on her bus. The students that are on her bus are okay (no one is hurt) but are pulled over waiting for the State Police to arrive. Currently, we do not have an estimated time for drop off for the remaining students on her bus, but we are working on getting another bus to that location. Thank you for your understanding and patience as we are ensuring the safety of your children.
text:
Update on April's Bus:
A truck just crossed the center line and hit April's side mirror on her bus. The students that are on her bus are okay (no one is hurt) but are pulled over waiting for the State Police to arrive. Currently, we do not have an estimated time for drop off for the remaining students on her bus, but we are working on getting another bus to that location. Thank you for your understanding and patience as we are ensuring the safety of your children.

PLEASE JOIN US FOR OUR VERY FIRST RAIDER PRIDE 5K RUN/WALK

SATURDAY, MAY 4TH AT 9:00 AM AT CARRIE RICKER SCHOOL

$20 REGISTRATION FEE FOR ADULTS
$10 REGISTRATION FEE FOR STUDENTS 18 AND UNDER

Prizes: First male & female students and first male and female adults win $40 gift cards to Amazon. The Best Raider Pride costume will win a Smart FIT slim health monitor and activity tracker. . Show us your school spirit!

First 100 who sign up for the race get a Raider 5k race T-shirt!!!!!!

Register: https://runsignup.com/Race/ME/Litchfield/RaiderPride5K

Due to the weather forecast later in the day, we will be dismissing early:
OHHS & OHMS will be dismissing at 11:15 am
LTS, SPS, & CRS will be dismissing at 12:30 pm.

There will be no afternoon pre-k, no after school care and no after school activities.

OHHS & OHMS will be dismissing at 11:15 am
LTS, SPS, & CRS will be dismissing at 12:30 pm.

There will be no afternoon pre-k, no after school care and no after school activities.

post_text: Learning, networking and collaboration for our RSU #4 staff.
text: Learning, networking and collaboration for our RSU #4 staff.

post_text:
Getting ready for our workshop day at UMF with WMEC Rendezvous.

The Rendezvous spurs sharing and collaboration among educators to improve teaching and learning. Educators share professional knowledge and expertise to benefit the 14,000 students in WMEC districts.

While this year’s event is the largest the WMEC has convened, our cross-district collaboration and pooling of resources has been happening since 2005. This year’s event grew out of a highly successful Rendezvous in 2018, where we had nearly 800 educators in attendance and a 95% positive feedback rating.

2019 Rendezvous: 90 volunteer presenters, with majority being WMEC educators; 100 workshops offered in 3 sessions and educators self-select options to best meet their needs; 1400+ educators from 13 WMEC districts.
text:
Getting ready for our workshop day at UMF with WMEC Rendezvous.

The Rendezvous spurs sharing and collaboration among educators to improve teaching and learning. Educators share professional knowledge and expertise to benefit the 14,000 students in WMEC districts.

While this year’s event is the largest the WMEC has convened, our cross-district collaboration and pooling of resources has been happening since 2005. This year’s event grew out of a highly successful Rendezvous in 2018, where we had nearly 800 educators in attendance and a 95% positive feedback rating.

2019 Rendezvous: 90 volunteer presenters, with majority being WMEC educators; 100 workshops offered in 3 sessions and educators self-select options to best meet their needs; 1400+ educators from 13 WMEC districts.

post_text:
PLEASE JOIN US FOR OUR VERY FIRST RAIDER PRIDE 5K RUN/WALK

SATURDAY, MAY 4TH AT 9:00 AM

AT CARRIE RICKER SCHOOL

$20 REGISTRATION FEE FOR ADULTS
$10 REGISTRATION FEE FOR STUDENTS 18 AND UNDER

The run will be begin at Carrie Ricker School. We promise it will be an easy, flat course down Academy Road and back.

We are raising money for the District Wellness committee to use for Student Wellness activities in classroom and Staff Wellness.

Prizes for : First male & female students; first male and female adults, and a prize will be given for the best Raider Pride costume. Show us your school spirt! Registrations begin on January 28th!

To register: https://runsignup.com/Race/ME/Litchfield/RaiderPride5K
